stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the session building and troubleshooting Course 14, a craft-themed stage made from cardboard, glue and other art-supply props. He debugs a crash, measures framerate on real N64, and experiments with textures, lighting and skybox tricks to keep performance acceptable while selling the handmade look. He also chats about YouTube strategy, a forthcoming demo, and team progress.

development_findings.summary: A recent ‘optimization from chat’ broke a scale-index loop, causing a crash; Kaze reverted the change and the game runs again
development_findings.quote: Alright, I will undo this optimization from chat. Cool.

development_findings.summary: Real-hardware FPS dropped after edits to Course 1; Kaze logs timings and searches for bottlenecks (RSP vs. game loop) to keep the hack playable on N64 hardware
development_findings.quote: Ren went to 5.2… Game loop is half a second more. Doesn’t make much sense to me.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 will live inside a paper cylinder with cardboard mountains around the rim and a death floor disguised as painted water or gift-wrap
development_findings.quote: It would make sense if this course was on a giant table… but I want there to be a death floor so maybe we need to innovate a different way to make a death floor look.

development_findings.summary: Key new mechanics for Course 14: glue surfaces that stop jumps, scissors enemies that ‘snip’, pipe-cleaner Goombas, ruler trampoline, popsicle-stick/foam/yarn props, cotton-ball clouds (if poly budget allows)
Implemented a cheap ‘fake normal map’/rim-light shader so painted walls glisten as the camera moves
development_findings.quote: Shall I add a fake normal map to this? So that when you turn the camera, there’s like highlights… Oh, that would look so good.

development_findings.summary: Uses hex-tessellated floor, single-mesh refactor and culling tweaks to reduce overdraw and collision-node overflow on open areas

Overall content status: 14 of 15 main courses blocked out; Course 15 assets half-done; side levels, overworld and Bowser still pending; demo planned once Course 1 remake and performance pass are finished
development_findings.quote: Yes, we’re only at course 14 out of 15… Course 15 is already halfway done… Biobak is currently still working on the Course 1 remake. I want that to be in the demo.

context_findings.summary: YouTube now treated as ‘the job’; game dev is ‘the fun part’. Kaze hired an external editor and is planning a slate of 20+ long-form videos to feed algorithm
context_findings.quote: For me, YouTube at this point—this the job part and making the game is the fun part.

context_findings.summary: Latest video over-performs (80 % more views; could hit 1 M). This success influences content planning and dev time
context_findings.quote: This might be a 1 million view banger.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is on vacation with two days left before returning to his day job, hinting at limited dev time
context_findings.quote: I just have three more days of vacation and then it’s back to work… it’s just two days after today.

context_findings.summary: Tested ChatGPT-01 coding model; found it ‘helped a little’, shows cautious interest in AI assistance
context_findings.quote: Just this morning, I tested CGPT01… it actually helped a little bit.

context_findings.summary: Cautious about publishing technical RSP video until he fully understands the topic and Sauraen’s research is done
context_findings.quote: I’m not entirely comfortable making this video yet, because there’s so much RSP stuff I don’t understand yet.

context_findings.summary: Wants to re-release ‘The Missing Link’ despite previous Nintendo takedown, showing willingness to revisit legal gray areas
context_findings.quote: I definitely want to re-release Missing Link at some point.

biobak.summary: Working on Course 1 remake required for the public demo
biobak.quote: Biobak is currently still working on the Course 1 remake. I want that to be in the demo.

biobak.summary: Suggested enclosing Course 14 inside a paper cylinder with drawings on it

key_stories.title: Optimization Gone Wrong
key_stories.summary: Chat suggested a scale-index optimization that looked safe but introduced a crash in a large function. Kaze spent part of the stream chasing the fault and ultimately rolled back the change.
key_stories.challenge: Game crashed due to out-of-range scale indices after recent code tweak.
key_stories.process: Reviewed recent commits, logged values, compared loops, identified bad index ‘minus 2’, reverted patch.
key_stories.outcome: Crash resolved; lesson on cautious community-driven optimizations.
key_stories.key_quote: Alright, I will undo this optimization from chat.

key_stories.title: Crafting Course 14
key_stories.summary: Kaze blocks out a cardboard & glue level, experimenting live with textures, skybox tricks and new mechanics while balancing N64 performance limits.
key_stories.challenge: Create visually rich ‘arts-and-crafts’ environment without misleading players or overloading hardware.
key_stories.process: Tested water/gift-wrap floors, paper cylinder walls, rim-light shaders, glue physics, enemy concepts; adjusted meshes and culling.
key_stories.outcome: Visual direction locked (paper cylinder, gift-wrap water, taped seams); to-do list set for clouds, props and collision polishing.
key_stories.key_quote: This will be course 14. Everything is made out of cardboard and craft materials.

key_stories.title: Balancing YouTube and Development
key_stories.summary: Kaze deliberates which of 20 video ideas to produce next, analyzing algorithm preferences, legal risks and personal readiness.
key_stories.challenge: Maintain channel growth while allocating time to game development.
key_stories.process: Shares list with chat, weighs RSP tech piece vs. ‘Missing Link’ story, notes editor support and video length strategy.
key_stories.outcome: No final pick yet; community feedback gathered; confirms editor frees up dev time.
key_stories.key_quote: For me, YouTube is the job part and making the game is the fun part.

open_questions.topic: N64 performance target and optimisation pipeline
open_questions.context: Kaze logs FPS drops and mentions aiming for ‘10 min max’ but exact performance goals and toolchain are unclear.
questions: What framerate and latency targets are you setting for real hardware?
What profiling tools and workflows do you rely on day-to-day?
How do you decide when visual ambition outweighs performance on N64?

open_questions.context: Stream shows early glue surfaces that cancel jumps but details of physics, visuals and edge cases are unresolved.
questions: How will glue interact with different moves (long jump, dive, wall-kick)?
What cues tell players it’s glue and not dangerous liquid?
Any technical tricks to minimise CPU cost of sticky surfaces?

open_questions.context: Biobak is rewriting Course 1 for the public demo; timeline and scope not discussed.
questions: What’s the scope of the remake—layout overhaul or purely visual?
How do you two iterate—shared repo, weekly calls?
What constraints (poly count, memory) guide Biobak’s new assets?

open_questions.context: Stream references Sauraen (RSP work) and Eiza (Course 15 assets) but not their responsibilities.
questions: Who are Sauraen and Eiza, and how do they integrate with the core team?
How is task ownership divided among contributors?
What tools (Discord, Trello, Git) keep everyone in sync?

open_questions.topic: Legal strategy for re-releasing ‘The Missing Link’
open_questions.context: Kaze wants to re-upload despite prior Nintendo takedown.
questions: What safeguards or alterations could make a re-release safer?
Did the takedown affect Return to Yoshi’s Island plans?
How do legal risks shape future marketing and distribution?

open_questions.context: Vacation ending, day job returning, YouTube and game dev competing for time.
questions: How do you balance a day job, YouTube and a large ROM-hack?
What tasks get delegated to the new editor or collaborators?
Have you set boundaries to avoid crunch?
